intro: Silene austroiranica, commonly known as the Iranian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Silene austroiranica is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
